located on the easternmost point in Sweden. It is twinned with

The easternmost outpost of Sweden since 1809 when Finland was lost to Russia. Haparanda has always been an important trading post, this continues until this day with the world's northernmost IKEA store, bringing customers from all across the
. It is a great gateway to the wild north of Scandinavia. Most people here speak both
Arriving by car is easy since Haparanda is on the E4 with roads in good shape. It is a border town so there is a fair share of heavy duty traffic coming through.
Although Haparanda boasts a train station, there is no passenger service. Two daily

with a connecting express bus to Haparanda waiting.

between Helsinki and Kolari stops in

with quite frequent connections from all parts of Finland - from there you can take the bus to Tornio and walk across to Haparanda.

value: depart according to local Finnish time

, which is one hour ahead of time in Haparanda. The central organization for intercity bus traffic in Finland, Matkahuolto, provides schedule and ticket information on their
Haparanda has no airport of its own, the nearest one being
on the Finnish side (24km from Haparanda) from where Finncomm Airlines runs scheduled flights to Helsinki. From there you'll have to continue with the bus service provided by
, the nearest bus stop of Kemi airport is named
connects most part of Haparanda and Tornio, fares are 15 SEK or €2 for a single trip.

value: content=Church constructed in 1963 to replace the old church of Haparanda that was burned down. Sometimes called the ugliest church in Sweden due to the copper sheet that has darkened over the years.
content=Located at the northern outskirts of Haparanda.
content=Hermansons trading house was built in 1832 and it is one of the best preserved buildings in Northern Sweden.
content=The station building was constructed in 1918.
content=Like Paris and Pisa, also Haparanda has a tower overlooking the city!
content=The beautiful park includes two large islands, Seskarö and Seskar Furö, and a number of smaller islands and skerries. There is a boat going to Sandskär Island in June
. Both ringed seal and grey seal can be seen in the waters of the national park.

content=Different types of saunas and a fantastic view to the rapids. Local products from Meän Baakeri-bakery. A great restaurant and a café. In the summer time you can participate in long-handle net fishing and river rafting.
content=Net fishing, fishing from a boat. Try the different saunas and have a barbecue at the grilling area! Also camping places for caravans and campers.
content=Situated 3 km north of Haparanda. Try the local strawberries, black currants and broccoli! You can also buy these delicacies home, and even pick them yourself! Mattila, Haparanda,
directions=6 km north of central Haparanda

content=Guided nature trips, trips to the forest for mushrooms and berries. Hunting, tractor safaris, clay-pigeon shooting, go-kart track and a smoke sauna. Unique experiences and fun! Also a summer café and restaurant. On the premises there is a hostel in a former a gardening and agricultural school. Rooms start at 200 SEK (approx. 25 euros).
content=An exciting go-kart track situated 9 km north of Haparanda.
content=A small animal farm with a donkey, a shetland pony, mini pigs, reindeers, a goat, rabbits and cats.
content=The largest candy store in Europe! A new playground for children.
content=A music event in Haparanda with top Swedish artists.

Both Swedish krona and Euro are accepted in most stores.

value: content=The northernmost IKEA in the world, opened a few years ago and attracts people not only from northern Sweden but Norway, Finland and even Russia. The largest candy store in Europe among other interesting shops can be found in the IKEA operated
mall next to the furniture store itself.
content=Situated in a beautiful country environment 35km north from Haparanda, in the Hulkoff manor (Hulkoffgården). The name translates to "The shop on the countryside"
content=Situated 3 km north of Haparanda. You can buy tasty strawberries, fresh black currants and other local products or have a coffee in a beautiful early 19th century environment.
content=Furniture and othe locally made wooden objects.

There are several cheap restaurants scatterd in the city center, some serve only lunch. For cheap crub, head out the in-store IKEA restaurant.

value: content=A cosy café and lunch restaurant. Lunch is served M-F 11-13.30.
content=Pizza, grilled food, kebab, tex mex and salad.
directions=in the Coop building 100m from the border crossing
content=A hamburger restaurant with all sorts of freshly made hamburgers and salads, free WiFi and view towards Tornio.
content=During summer time à la carte and bistro every day until 21 o'clock. Buffet Sat-Sun 13-18.
content=An ecological restaurant where they serve food produced at the farm. Also offers high standard Bed and Breakfast accommodation. Possibility to fish and hunt.
hours=11AM-11PM in the summer, 11AM-2PM in the winter
content=Located 14 km from central Haparanda this resturant serves mostly fish and wild game.
content=À la carte every day at 16-22. Game cellar, pub, Café Gulasch Baronen, night club.
content=Coffee and tea products. Open M-F 10-17, Sat 12-17
content=A youth café where you can surf the Internet and play pool.
content=Fresh bakery products. Open M-F 8-17, Sat 9-15
content=Situated by Tornio River in Haparanda centre. 23 rooms. Book ahead of time, as the reception desk is not always open during the advertised hours (16:00-19:00).
content=Situated 35 km north of Haparanda. Comfortable rooms for 2-4 people, cottages, saunas.
content=Situated 25 km west of the Swedish Karungi village. Rooms and cottages for rent. Several saunas, a large hut, a scooter café and food.
content=Tent and caravan/camper spots and a large cottage.
directions=Situated in the beautiful Seskarö island, 25 km south of Haparanda.
content=The camping site is open during the summer. Various cottages and camper/caravan/tent spots. A beach, mini golf track, campfire places and possibility to fish. Kiosk and grill-café.
content=Situated 3 km north of Haparanda centre. 10 rooms and 50 camping places., Haparanda.
content=Situated in Haparanda centre. 23 hotel standard rooms and cooking facilities. In summer time also 28 hostel rooms.
content=Situated 8 km north of Haparanda in charming countryside surroundings.
content=Situated 35 km north of Haparanda. A well equipped cottage for 7 people. Farm animals.
content=Old-time glory in Haparanda centre. 92 rooms, a restaurant, game cellar, sauna compartment. Located dead center of the city.
content=Situated 15 km north of Haparanda next to beautiful rapids. Cottages, different types of saunas and a restaurant. Also places for tents, campers and caravans.
